intro: Leucas neuflizeana var. princei, commonly known as the Prince's leucas, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, pale blue or purple flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
